skill.name: session-template
skill.description: Apply task-specific templates to AI session plans using ai-update-plan. Use when starting a new task to load appropriate plan structure (feature, bugfix, refactor, documentation, security).
skill.summary: Apply task-specific templates to AI session plans using ai-update-plan. Use when starting a new task...
skill.author: Atyantik

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown template files with no executable code. It provides structured planning guidance for AI development sessions. No network access, filesystem operations, or command execution capabilities exist.

content.user_title: Apply structured task templates to AI sessions
content.value_statement: Starting new AI tasks lacks structure. This skill provides pre-built planning templates for feature development, bug fixes, refactoring, documentation, and security work, ensuring comprehensive task coverage.
actual_capabilities: Apply feature development template with TDD phases
Apply bug fix template with reproduction steps
Apply refactoring template with safety nets
Apply documentation template with content audit
Apply security template with vulnerability assessment
limitations: Requires ai-update-plan CLI tool for full integration
Templates are starting points that need customization
Does not execute code or modify files automatically
Relies on user to follow and update the plan

use_cases.title: Structured feature development
use_cases.description: Add new functionality following TDD with research, implementation, and quality phases.

use_cases.title: Systematic bug fixing
use_cases.description: Fix bugs reliably with reproduction, root cause analysis, and regression prevention.

use_cases.title: Documentation updates
use_cases.description: Update documentation with content audit, planning, and validation phases.

prompt_templates.title: Start feature development
prompt_templates.prompt: apply feature development template for "Add OAuth2 authentication"

prompt_templates.title: Fix reported bug
prompt_templates.prompt: apply bugfix template for "Fix memory leak in data processor"

prompt_templates.title: Refactor code module
prompt_templates.prompt: apply refactoring template for "Clean up authentication module"

prompt_templates.title: Create custom template
prompt_templates.prompt: suggest template for "Deploy API to production" and customize for my deployment workflow

output_examples.input: apply feature development template for "Add user notification system"
output: Phases: Research & Design (5 items), Write Tests (5 items), Implementation (5 items), Refactoring (5 items), Quality Check (5 items), Documentation (4 items), Final Review (3 items)
Next step: Run `uv run ai-update-plan --show` to view your customized plan

best_practices: Apply template early in the session for comprehensive planning
Customize generic items immediately to match your specific task
Remove items that do not apply to your situation
anti_patterns: Applying template without reading project documentation first
Keeping all generic items without task-specific customization
Skipping phases like TDD or quality checks for speed

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires ai-update-plan CLI tool.

faq.question: How many template types are available?
faq.answer: Five templates: feature, bugfix, refactor, documentation, and security. Each designed for specific task types.

faq.question: Can I create custom templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Create new markdown files in templates/ directory following the phase structure with checkbox format.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads local template files. No network access, file modification, or code execution.

faq.question: Why should I read project documentation first?
faq.answer: Templates need customization for project-specific conventions. Understanding project context ensures appropriate template selection.

faq.question: How does this differ from other planning tools?
faq.answer: Templates are AI-session specific with TDD phases, quality gates, and integration with ai-update-plan for progress tracking.
